PacketDefinitions.Description: This file contains all packet definitions for packets which are sent from game server to client.

Structure.Name: StoredItem
Structure.Description: The structure for a stored item, e.g. in the inventory or vault.

Structure.Name: PlayerShopItem
Structure.Description: Data of an item in a player shop.

Structure.Name: QuestIdentification
Structure.Description: Defines the information which identifies a quest.

Structure.Name: QuestCondition
Structure.Description: Defines a condition which must be fulfilled to complete the quest.

Field.Name: RequirementId
Field.Description: Depending on the condition type, this field contains the identifier of the required thing, e.g. Monster Number, Item Id, Level.

Field.Name: RequiredItemData
Field.Description: If the condition type is 'Item', this field contains the item data, excluding the item id. The item id can be found in the RequirementId field.

Structure.Name: QuestReward
Structure.Description: Defines a reward which is given when the quest is completed.

Field.Name: RewardId
Field.Description: Depending on the condition type, this field contains the identifier of the required thing, e.g. Monster Number, Item Id, Level.

Field.Name: RewardedItemData
Field.Description: If the reward type is 'Item', this field contains its item data.

Packet.Name: GameServerEntered
Packet.SentWhen: After a game client has connected to the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: It shows the login dialog.

Packet.Name: MagicEffectStatus
Packet.SentWhen: A magic effect was added or removed to the own or another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The user interface updates itself. If it's the effect of the own player, it's shown as icon at the top of the interface.

Packet.Name: WeatherStatusUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: The weather on the current map has been changed or the player entered the map.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the weather effects.

Field.Name: Weather
Field.Description: A random value between 0 and 2 (inclusive).

Field.Name: Variation
Field.Description: A random value between 0 and 9 (inclusive).

Packet.Name: AddCharactersToScope
Packet.SentWhen: One or more character got into the observed scope of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the character to the shown map.

Structure.Name: CharacterData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of an NPC.

Field.Name: EffectCount
Field.Description: Defines the number of effects which would be sent after this field.

Structure.Name: EffectId
Structure.Description: Contains the id of a magic effect.

Packet.Name: AddCharactersToScope075
Packet.SentWhen: One or more character got into the observed scope of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the character to the shown map.

Structure.Name: CharacterData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of an NPC.

Packet.Name: AddNpcsToScope
Packet.SentWhen: One or more NPCs got into the observed scope of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the NPCs to the shown map.

Structure.Name: NpcData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of an NPC.

Field.Name: EffectCount
Field.Description: Defines the number of effects which would be sent after this field. This is currently not supported.

Packet.Name: AddNpcsToScope075
Packet.SentWhen: One or more NPCs got into the observed scope of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the NPCs to the shown map.

Structure.Name: NpcData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of an NPC.

Packet.Name: AddSummonedMonstersToScope
Packet.SentWhen: One or more summoned monsters got into the observed scope of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the monsters to the shown map.

Structure.Name: SummonedMonsterData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of an NPC.

Field.Name: EffectCount
Field.Description: Defines the number of effects which would be sent after this field. This is currently not supported.

Structure.Name: EffectId
Structure.Description: Contains the id of a magic effect.

Packet.Name: AddSummonedMonstersToScope075
Packet.SentWhen: One or more summoned monsters got into the observed scope of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the monsters to the shown map.

Structure.Name: SummonedMonsterData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of an NPC.

Packet.Name: MapObjectOutOfScope
Packet.SentWhen: One or more objects (player, npc, etc.) on the map got out of scope, e.g. when the own player moved away from it/them or the object itself moved.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client removes the objects from the game map.

Structure.Name: ObjectId
Structure.Description: Contains the id of a object.

Packet.Name: ObjectGotKilled
Packet.SentWhen: An observed object was killed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The object is shown as dead.

Packet.Name: ObjectAnimation
Packet.SentWhen: An object performs an animation.
Packet.CausedReaction: The animation is shown for the specified object.

Packet.Name: AreaSkillAnimation
Packet.SentWhen: An object performs a skill which has effect on an area.
Packet.CausedReaction: The animation is shown on the user interface.

Packet.Name: SkillAnimation
Packet.SentWhen: An object performs a skill which is directly targeted to another object.
Packet.CausedReaction: The animation is shown on the user interface.

Packet.Name: AreaSkillAnimation075
Packet.SentWhen: An object performs a skill which has effect on an area.
Packet.CausedReaction: The animation is shown on the user interface.

Packet.Name: SkillAnimation075
Packet.SentWhen: An object performs a skill which is directly targeted to another object.
Packet.CausedReaction: The animation is shown on the user interface.

Packet.Name: MagicEffectCancelled
Packet.SentWhen: A player cancelled a specific magic effect of a skill (Infinity Arrow, Wizardry Enhance), or an effect was removed due a timeout (Ice, Poison) or antidote.
Packet.CausedReaction: The effect is removed from the target object.

Packet.Name: MagicEffectCancelled075
Packet.SentWhen: A player cancelled a specific magic effect of a skill (Infinity Arrow, Wizardry Enhance), or an effect was removed due a timeout (Ice, Poison) or antidote.
Packet.CausedReaction: The effect is removed from the target object.

Packet.Name: AppearanceChanged
Packet.SentWhen: The appearance of a player changed, all surrounding players are informed about it.
Packet.CausedReaction: The appearance of the player is updated.

Packet.Name: ObjectMessage
Packet.SentWhen: The server wants to show a message above any kind of character, even NPCs.
Packet.CausedReaction: The message is shown above the character.

Packet.Name: PartyRequest
Packet.SentWhen: Another player requests party from the receiver of this message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The party request is shown.

Packet.Name: PartyList
Packet.SentWhen: A player joined a party or requested the current party list by opening the party dialog.
Packet.CausedReaction: The party list is updated.

Structure.Name: PartyMember
Structure.Description: Data about a party member.

Packet.Name: PartyList075
Packet.SentWhen: A player joined a party or requested the current party list by opening the party dialog.
Packet.CausedReaction: The party list is updated.

Structure.Name: PartyMember
Structure.Description: Data about a party member.

Packet.Name: RemovePartyMember
Packet.SentWhen: A party member got removed from a party in which the player is in.
Packet.CausedReaction: The party member with the specified index is removed from the party list on the user interface.

Packet.Name: PartyHealthUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: Periodically, when the health state of the party changed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The party health list is updated.

Structure.Name: PartyMemberHealth
Structure.Description: Health of a party member

Field.Name: Value
Field.Description: A value from 0 to 10 about the health of a player. 10 means the current health is 100% of the maximum health.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopOpenSuccessful
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to open his shop and this request was successful.
Packet.CausedReaction: The own player shop is shown as open.

Packet.Name: TradeButtonStateChanged
Packet.SentWhen: After the trading partner checked or unchecked the trade accept button.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the trade button state accordingly.

Enum.Name: TradeButtonState
Enum.Description: Defines the state of the trade button.

EnumValue.Name: Unchecked
EnumValue.Description: Trade button is not pressed. It means that the trade is not yet accepted by the trader.

EnumValue.Name: Checked
EnumValue.Description: Trade Button is pressed. It means that the trade is accepted by the trader.

EnumValue.Name: Red
EnumValue.Description: This state is only sent to the client. After some seconds the client is changing back to normal Unchecked.

Packet.Name: TradeMoneySetResponse
Packet.SentWhen: The trade money has been set by a previous request of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The money which was set into the trade by the player is updated on the UI.

Packet.Name: TradeMoneyUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: This message is sent when the trading partner put a certain amount of money (also 0) into the trade.
Packet.CausedReaction: It overrides all previous sent money values.

Packet.Name: TradeRequestAnswer
Packet.SentWhen: The player which receives this message, sent a trade request to another player. This message is sent when the other player responded to this request.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the trade was accepted, a trade dialog is opened. Otherwise, a message is shown.

Packet.Name: TradeRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A trade was requested by another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: A trade request dialog is shown.

Packet.Name: TradeFinished
Packet.SentWhen: A trade was finished.
Packet.CausedReaction: The trade dialog is closed. Depending on the result, a message is shown.

Enum.Name: TradeResult
Enum.Description: Defines the result of a finished trade.

EnumValue.Name: Cancelled
EnumValue.Description: The trade was cancelled.

EnumValue.Name: Success
EnumValue.Description: The trade was successful.

EnumValue.Name: FailedByFullInventory
EnumValue.Description: The trade failed because of a full inventory.

EnumValue.Name: TimedOut
EnumValue.Description: The trade failed because the request timed out.

EnumValue.Name: FailedByItemsNotAllowedToTrade
EnumValue.Description: The trade failed because one or more items were not allowed to trade.

Packet.Name: TradeItemAdded
Packet.SentWhen: The trading partner added an item to the trade.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is added in the trade dialog.

Packet.Name: TradeItemRemoved
Packet.SentWhen: The trading partner removed an item from the trade.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is removed from the trade dialog.

Packet.Name: LoginResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the login request has been processed by the server.
Packet.CausedReaction: Shows the result. When it was successful, the client proceeds by sending a character list request.

Enum.Name: LoginResult
Enum.Description: The result of a login request.

EnumValue.Name: InvalidPassword
EnumValue.Description: The password was wrong.

EnumValue.Name: Okay
EnumValue.Description: The login succeeded.

EnumValue.Name: AccountInvalid
EnumValue.Description: The account is invalid.

EnumValue.Name: AccountAlreadyConnected
EnumValue.Description: The account is already connected.

EnumValue.Name: ServerIsFull
EnumValue.Description: The server is full.

EnumValue.Name: AccountBlocked
EnumValue.Description: The account is blocked.

EnumValue.Name: WrongVersion
EnumValue.Description: The game client has the wrong version.

EnumValue.Name: ConnectionError
EnumValue.Description: An internal error occured during connection.

EnumValue.Name: ConnectionClosed3Fails
EnumValue.Description: Connection closed because of three failed login requests.

EnumValue.Name: NoChargeInfo
EnumValue.Description: There is no payment information.

EnumValue.Name: SubscriptionTermOver
EnumValue.Description: The subscription term is over.

EnumValue.Name: SubscriptionTimeOver
EnumValue.Description: The subscription time is over.

EnumValue.Name: TemporaryBlocked
EnumValue.Description: The account is temporarily blocked.

EnumValue.Name: OnlyPlayersOver15Yrs
EnumValue.Description: Only players over 15 years are allowed to connect.

EnumValue.Name: BadCountry
EnumValue.Description: The client connected from a blocked country.

Packet.Name: LogoutResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the logout request has been processed by the server.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the result, the game client closes the game or changes to another selection screen.

Packet.Name: ChatMessage
Packet.SentWhen: A player sends a chat message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The message is shown in the chat box and above the character of the sender.

Enum.Name: ChatMessageType
Enum.Description: Defines the type of a chat message.

EnumValue.Name: Normal
EnumValue.Description: The message is a normal chat message, e.g. public, within a party or guild.

EnumValue.Name: Whisper
EnumValue.Description: The message is sent privately to the receiving player.

Packet.Name: ObjectHit
Packet.SentWhen: An object got hit in two cases: 1. When the own player is hit; 2. When the own player attacked some other object which got hit.
Packet.CausedReaction: The damage is shown at the object which received the hit.

Enum.Name: DamageKind
Enum.Description: Defines the kind of the damage.

EnumValue.Name: NormalRed
EnumValue.Description: Red color, used by normal damage.

EnumValue.Name: IgnoreDefenseCyan
EnumValue.Description: Cyan color, usually used by ignore defense damage.

EnumValue.Name: ExcellentLightGreen
EnumValue.Description: Light green color, usually used by excellent damage.

EnumValue.Name: CriticalBlue
EnumValue.Description: Blue color, usually used by critical damage.

EnumValue.Name: LightPink
EnumValue.Description: Light pink color.

EnumValue.Name: PoisonDarkGreen
EnumValue.Description: Dark green color, usually used by poison damage.

EnumValue.Name: ReflectedDarkPink
EnumValue.Description: Dark pink color, usually used by reflected damage.

EnumValue.Name: White
EnumValue.Description: White color.

Packet.Name: ObjectMoved
Packet.SentWhen: An object in the observed scope (including the own player) moved instantly.
Packet.CausedReaction: The position of the object is updated on client side.

Packet.Name: ObjectWalked
Packet.SentWhen: An object in the observed scope (including the own player) walked to another position.
Packet.CausedReaction: The object is animated to walk to the new position.

Packet.Name: ObjectWalked075
Packet.SentWhen: An object in the observed scope (including the own player) walked to another position.
Packet.CausedReaction: The object is animated to walk to the new position.

Packet.Name: ExperienceGained
Packet.SentWhen: A player gained experience.
Packet.CausedReaction: The experience is added to the experience counter and bar.

Packet.Name: MapChanged
Packet.SentWhen: The map was changed on the server side.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client changes to the specified map and coordinates.

Field.Name: IsMapChange
Field.Description: If false, it shows the teleport animation (white bubbles), and the client doesn't remove all of the objects in its scope.

Packet.Name: MapChanged075
Packet.SentWhen: The map was changed on the server side.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client changes to the specified map and coordinates.

Field.Name: IsMapChange
Field.Description: If false, it shows the teleport animation (white bubbles), and the client doesn't remove all of the objects in its scope.

Packet.Name: ApplyKeyConfiguration
Packet.SentWhen: When entering the game world with a character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client restores this configuration in its user interface.

Field.Name: Configuration
Field.Description: The binary data of the key configuration

Packet.Name: ItemsDropped
Packet.SentWhen: The items dropped on the ground.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the items to the ground.

Structure.Name: DroppedItem
Structure.Description: Contains the data about a dropped item.

Field.Name: IsFreshDrop
Field.Description: If this flag is set, the item is added to the map with an animation and sound. Otherwise it's just added like it was already on the ground before.

Packet.Name: MoneyDropped
Packet.SentWhen: Money dropped on the ground.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the money to the ground.

Field.Name: IsFreshDrop
Field.Description: If this flag is set, the money is added to the map with an animation and sound. Otherwise it's just added like it was already on the ground before.

Packet.Name: MoneyDropped075
Packet.SentWhen: Money dropped on the ground.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the money to the ground.

Field.Name: IsFreshDrop
Field.Description: If this flag is set, the money is added to the map with an animation and sound. Otherwise it's just added like it was already on the ground before.

Packet.Name: ItemDropRemoved
Packet.SentWhen: A dropped item was removed from the ground of the map, e.g. when it timed out or was picked up.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client removes the item from the ground of the map.

Structure.Name: DroppedItemId
Structure.Description: Contains the id of a dropped item.

Packet.Name: ItemAddedToInventory
Packet.SentWhen: A new item was added to the inventory.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the item to the inventory user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemDropResponse
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to drop an item of his inventory. This message is the response about the success of the request.
Packet.CausedReaction: If successful, the client removes the item from the inventory user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemPickUpRequestFailed
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to pick up an item from to ground to add it to his inventory, but it failed.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the reason, the game client shows a message.

Enum.Name: ItemPickUpFailReason
Enum.Description: Defines the possible fail reasons

EnumValue.Name: ItemStacked
EnumValue.Description: The picked up item was combined into an existing item of the players inventory. A separate durability update will be sent to the client.

EnumValue.Name: __MaximumInventoryMoneyReached
EnumValue.Description: The maximum inventory money has been reached, so the money wasn't picked up. Should not be used, because it's used in the InventoryMoneyUpdate message.

EnumValue.Name: General
EnumValue.Description: The general, non-specific reason. It just failed.

Packet.Name: InventoryMoneyUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: The players money amount of the inventory has been changed and needs an update.
Packet.CausedReaction: The money is updated in the inventory user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemMoved
Packet.SentWhen: An item in the inventory or vault of the player has been moved.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client updates the position of item in the user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemMoveRequestFailed
Packet.SentWhen: An item in the inventory or vault of the player could not be moved as requested by the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client restores the position of item in the user interface.

Packet.Name: CurrentHealthAndShield
Packet.SentWhen: Periodically, or if the current health or shield changed on the server side, e.g. by hits.
Packet.CausedReaction: The health and shield bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: MaximumHealthAndShield
Packet.SentWhen: When the maximum health changed, e.g. by adding stat points or changed items.
Packet.CausedReaction: The health and shield bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemConsumptionFailed
Packet.SentWhen: When the consumption of an item failed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client gets a feedback about a failed consumption, and allows for do further consumption requests.

Packet.Name: CurrentManaAndAbility
Packet.SentWhen: The currently available mana or ability has changed, e.g. by using a skill.
Packet.CausedReaction: The mana and ability bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: MaximumManaAndAbility
Packet.SentWhen: The maximum available mana or ability has changed, e.g. by adding stat points.
Packet.CausedReaction: The mana and ability bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemRemoved
Packet.SentWhen: The item has been removed from the inventory of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client removes the item in the inventory user interface.

Field.Name: InventorySlot
Field.Description: The affected slot of the item in the inventory.

Packet.Name: ConsumeItemWithEffect
Packet.SentWhen: The client requested to consume a special item, e.g. a bottle of Ale.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player is shown in a red color and has increased attack speed.

Enum.Name: ConsumedItemType
Enum.Description: Defines a consumed item.

EnumValue.Name: Ale
EnumValue.Description: The player consumes a bottle of ale, usually 80 seconds effect time.

EnumValue.Name: RedemyOfLove
EnumValue.Description: The player consumes a redemy of love, usually 90 seconds effect time.

EnumValue.Name: PotionOfSoul
EnumValue.Description: The player consumes a potion of soul, usually 60 seconds effect time.

Packet.Name: ItemDurabilityChanged
Packet.SentWhen: The durability of an item in the inventory of the player has been changed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client updates the item in the inventory user interface.

Field.Name: ByConsumption
Field.Description: true, if the change resulted from an item consumption; otherwise, false

Packet.Name: FruitConsumptionResponse
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to consume a fruit.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client updates the user interface, by changing the added stat points and used fruit points.

Enum.Name: FruitConsumptionResult
Enum.Description: Defines the result of the fruit consumption request.

EnumValue.Name: PlusSuccess
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to add points was successful.

EnumValue.Name: PlusFailed
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to add points failed.

EnumValue.Name: PlusPrevented
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to add points was prevented because some conditions were not correct.

EnumValue.Name: MinusSuccess
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to remove points was successful.

EnumValue.Name: MinusFailed
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to remove points failed.

EnumValue.Name: MinusPrevented
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to remove points was prevented because some conditions were not correct.

EnumValue.Name: MinusSuccessCashShopFruit
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to remove points was successful, removed by a fruit acquired through the cash shop.

EnumValue.Name: PreventedByEquippedItems
EnumValue.Description: Consumption was prevented because an item was equipped.

EnumValue.Name: PlusPreventedByMaximum
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to add points was prevented because the maximum amount of points have been added.

EnumValue.Name: MinusPreventedByMaximum
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to remove points was prevented because the maximum amount of points have been removed.

EnumValue.Name: MinusPreventedByDefault
EnumValue.Description: Consumption to remove points was prevented because the base amount of stat points of the character class cannot be undercut.

Enum.Name: FruitStatType
Enum.Description: Defines the type of stat which the fruit modifies.

EnumValue.Name: Energy
EnumValue.Description: Fruit which modifies the energy stat.

EnumValue.Name: Vitality
EnumValue.Description: Fruit which modifies the vitality stat.

EnumValue.Name: Agility
EnumValue.Description: Fruit which modifies the agility stat.

EnumValue.Name: Strength
EnumValue.Description: Fruit which modifies the strength stat.

EnumValue.Name: Leadership
EnumValue.Description: Fruit which modifies the leadership stat.

Packet.Name: NpcWindowResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the client talked to an NPC which should cause a dialog to open on the client side.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client opens the specified dialog.

Enum.Name: NpcWindow
Enum.Description: Defines the kind of npc window which should be shown on the client.

EnumValue.Name: Merchant
EnumValue.Description: A merchant window.

EnumValue.Name: Merchant1
EnumValue.Description: Another merchant window.

EnumValue.Name: VaultStorage
EnumValue.Description: A vault storage.

EnumValue.Name: ChaosMachine
EnumValue.Description: A chaos machine window.

EnumValue.Name: DevilSquare
EnumValue.Description: A devil square window.

EnumValue.Name: BloodCastle
EnumValue.Description: A blood castle window.

EnumValue.Name: PetTrainer
EnumValue.Description: The pet trainer window.

EnumValue.Name: Lahap
EnumValue.Description: The lahap window.

EnumValue.Name: CastleSeniorNPC
EnumValue.Description: The castle senior window.

EnumValue.Name: ElphisRefinery
EnumValue.Description: The elphis refinery window.

EnumValue.Name: RefineStoneMaking
EnumValue.Description: The refine stone making window.

EnumValue.Name: RemoveJohOption
EnumValue.Description: The jewel of harmony option removal window.

EnumValue.Name: IllusionTemple
EnumValue.Description: The illusion temple window.

EnumValue.Name: ChaosCardCombination
EnumValue.Description: The chaos card combination window.

EnumValue.Name: CherryBlossomBranchesAssembly
EnumValue.Description: The cherry blossom branches assembly window.

EnumValue.Name: SeedMaster
EnumValue.Description: The seed master window.

EnumValue.Name: SeedResearcher
EnumValue.Description: The seed researcher window.

EnumValue.Name: StatReInitializer
EnumValue.Description: The stat reinitializer window.

EnumValue.Name: DelgadoLuckyCoinRegistration
EnumValue.Description: The delgado lucky coin registration window.

EnumValue.Name: DoorkeeperTitusDuelWatch
EnumValue.Description: The doorkeeper titus duel watch window.

EnumValue.Name: LugardDoppelgangerEntry
EnumValue.Description: The lugard doppelganger entry window.

EnumValue.Name: JerintGaionEvententry
EnumValue.Description: The jerint gaion event entry window.

EnumValue.Name: JuliaWarpMarketServer
EnumValue.Description: The julia warp market server window.

EnumValue.Name: CombineLuckyItem
EnumValue.Description: The dialog window which allows to exchange or refine Lucky Item. Used by NPC "David".

Packet.Name: StoreItemList
Packet.SentWhen: The player opens a merchant npc or the vault. It's sent after the dialog was opened by another message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the items in the opened dialog.

Enum.Name: ItemWindow
Enum.Description: Defines the kind of npc window which should be shown on the client.

EnumValue.Name: Normal
EnumValue.Description: A normal window.

EnumValue.Name: ChaosMachine
EnumValue.Description: A chaos machine window.

EnumValue.Name: ResurrectionFailed
EnumValue.Description: A failed resurrection (of Dark Horse or Dark Raven) storage dialog.

Packet.Name: NpcItemBuyFailed
Packet.SentWhen: The request of buying an item from a NPC failed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client is responsive again. Without this message, it may stuck.

Packet.Name: ItemBought
Packet.SentWhen: The request of buying an item from a player or npc was successful.
Packet.CausedReaction: The bought item is added to the inventory.

Packet.Name: NpcItemSellResult
Packet.SentWhen: The result of a previous item sell request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The amount of specified money is set at the players inventory.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopSetItemPriceResponse
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to set a price for an item of the players shop.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item gets a price on the user interface.

Enum.Name: ItemPriceSetResult
Enum.Description: Describes the possible results of setting an item price in a player shop.

EnumValue.Name: Failed
EnumValue.Description: Failed, e.g. because the shop feature is deactivated

EnumValue.Name: Success
EnumValue.Description: The price has been set successfully

EnumValue.Name: ItemSlotOutOfRange
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the item slot was out of range

EnumValue.Name: ItemNotFound
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the item could not be found

EnumValue.Name: PriceNegative
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the price was negative

EnumValue.Name: ItemIsBlocked
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the item is blocked

EnumValue.Name: CharacterLevelTooLow
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the character level is too low (below level 6)

Packet.Name: PlayerShopClosed
Packet.SentWhen: After a player in scope requested to close his shop or after all items has been sold.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player shop not shown as open anymore.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopItemSoldToPlayer
Packet.SentWhen: An item of the players shop was sold to another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is removed from the players inventory and a blue system message appears.

Packet.Name: ClosePlayerShopDialog
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to close his shop or after all items has been sold.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player shop dialog is closed for the shop of the specified player.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopItemList
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to open a shop of another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player shop dialog is shown with the provided item data.

Enum.Name: ActionKind
Enum.Description: The kind of action which led to the list message.

EnumValue.Name: ByRequest
EnumValue.Description: The list was requested.

EnumValue.Name: UpdateAfterItemChange
EnumValue.Description: The list was changed, e.g. because an item was sold.

Packet.Name: PlayerShops
Packet.SentWhen: After the player gets into scope of a player with an opened shop.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player shop title is shown at the specified players.

Structure.Name: PlayerShop
Structure.Description: Data of the shop of a player.

Packet.Name: AddTransformedCharactersToScope075
Packet.SentWhen: The player wears a monster transformation ring.
Packet.CausedReaction: The character appears as monster, defined by the Skin property.

Structure.Name: CharacterData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of an character.

Packet.Name: CharacterList
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested it, usually after a successful login.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the available characters of the account.

Structure.Name: CharacterData
Structure.Description: Data of one character in the list.

Packet.Name: CharacterList075
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested it, usually after a successful login.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the available characters of the account.

Structure.Name: CharacterData
Structure.Description: Data of one character in the list.

Packet.Name: CharacterCreationSuccessful
Packet.SentWhen: After the server successfully processed a character creation request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The new character is shown in the character list

Packet.Name: CharacterCreationFailed
Packet.SentWhen: After the server processed a character creation request without success.
Packet.CausedReaction: A message is shown that it failed.

Packet.Name: RespawnAfterDeath075
Packet.SentWhen: The character respawned after death.
Packet.CausedReaction: The character respawns with the specified attributes at the specified map.

Packet.Name: PoisonDamage
Packet.SentWhen: The character got damaged by being poisoned on old client versions.
Packet.CausedReaction: Removes the damage from the health without showing a damage number.

Packet.Name: HeroStateChanged
Packet.SentWhen: After a the hero state of an observed character changed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The color of the name of the character is changed accordingly and a message is shown.

Packet.Name: SkillAdded
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got added to the skill list, e.g. by equipping an item or learning a skill.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillRemoved
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got removed from the skill list, e.g. by removing an equipped item.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillListUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: Usually, when the player entered the game with a character. When skills get added or removed, this message is sent as well, but with a misleading count.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill list gets initialized.

Field.Name: Count
Field.Description: Mixed usage: Skill list count (when list). 0xFE when adding a skill, 0xFF when removing a Skill.

Structure.Name: SkillEntry
Structure.Description: Structure for a skill entry of the skill list.

Packet.Name: SkillAdded075
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got added to the skill list, e.g. by equipping an item or learning a skill.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillRemoved075
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got removed from the skill list, e.g. by removing an equipped item.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillListUpdate075
Packet.SentWhen: Usually, when the player entered the game with a character. When skills get added or removed, this message is sent as well, but with a misleading count.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill list gets initialized.

Field.Name: Count
Field.Description: Mixed usage: Skill list count (when list). 0xFE when adding a skill, 0xFF when removing a Skill.

Structure.Name: SkillEntry
Structure.Description: Structure for a skill entry of the skill list.

Packet.Name: CharacterFocused
Packet.SentWhen: After the client focused the character successfully on the server side.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client highlights the focused character.

Packet.Name: CharacterStatIncreaseResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the server processed a character stat increase request packet.
Packet.CausedReaction: If it was successful, adds a point to the requested stat type.

Packet.Name: CharacterDeleteResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the server processed a character delete response of the client.
Packet.CausedReaction: If successful, the character is deleted from the character selection screen. Otherwise, a message is shown.

Enum.Name: CharacterDeleteResult
Enum.Description: Result of a character delete request.

EnumValue.Name: Unsuccessful
EnumValue.Description: Deleting was not successful

EnumValue.Name: Successful
EnumValue.Description: Deleting was successful

EnumValue.Name: WrongSecurityCode
EnumValue.Description: Deleting was not successful because a wrong security code was entered

Packet.Name: CharacterLevelUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After a character leveled up.
Packet.CausedReaction: Updates the level (and other related stats) in the game client and shows an effect.

Packet.Name: CharacterInformation
Packet.SentWhen: After the character was selected by the player and entered the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The characters enters the game world.

Packet.Name: CharacterInformation075
Packet.SentWhen: After the character was selected by the player and entered the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The characters enters the game world.

Packet.Name: CharacterInventory
Packet.SentWhen: The player entered the game or finished a trade.
Packet.CausedReaction: The user interface of the inventory is initialized with all of its items.

Packet.Name: InventoryItemUpgraded
Packet.SentWhen: An item in the inventory got upgraded by the player, e.g. by applying a jewel.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is updated on the user interface.

Packet.Name: SummonHealthUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: When health of a summoned monster (Elf Skill) changed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The health is updated on the user interface.

Packet.Name: GuildSoccerTimeUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: Every second during a guild soccer match.
Packet.CausedReaction: The time is updated on the user interface.

Packet.Name: GuildSoccerScoreUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: Whenever the score of the soccer game changed, and at the beginning of the match.
Packet.CausedReaction: The score is updated on the user interface.

Packet.Name: MasterStatsUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After entering the game with a master class character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The master related data is available.

Packet.Name: MasterSkillLevelUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After a master skill level has been changed (usually increased).
Packet.CausedReaction: The level is updated in the master skill tree.

Field.Name: MasterSkillIndex
Field.Description: The index of the master skill on the clients master skill tree for the given character class.

Packet.Name: MasterSkillList
Packet.SentWhen: Usually after entering the game with a master character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The data is available in the master skill tree.

Structure.Name: MasterSkillEntry
Structure.Description: An entry in the master skill list.

Field.Name: MasterSkillIndex
Field.Description: The index of the master skill on the clients master skill tree for the given character class.

Enum.Name: MessageType
Enum.Description: Defines a type of a server message.

EnumValue.Name: GoldenCenter
EnumValue.Description: The message is shown as centered golden message in the client.

EnumValue.Name: BlueNormal
EnumValue.Description: The message is shown as a blue system message.

EnumValue.Name: GuildNotice
EnumValue.Description: The message is a guild notice, centered in green.

Packet.Name: GuildJoinRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requested to join a guild. This message is sent then to the guild master.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild master gets a message box with the request popping up.

Packet.Name: GuildJoinResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After a guild master responded to a request of a player to join his guild. This message is sent back to the requesting player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The requester gets a corresponding message showing.

Enum.Name: GuildJoinRequestResult
Enum.Description: The result of the guild join request.

EnumValue.Name: Refused
EnumValue.Description: Refused by the guild master.

EnumValue.Name: Accepted
EnumValue.Description: Accepted by the guild master.

EnumValue.Name: GuildFull
EnumValue.Description: The guild is full.

EnumValue.Name: Disconnected
EnumValue.Description: The guild master is disconnected.

EnumValue.Name: NotTheGuildMaster
EnumValue.Description: The requested player is not the guild master of its guild.

EnumValue.Name: AlreadyHaveGuild
EnumValue.Description: The player already has a guild.

EnumValue.Name: GuildMasterOrRequesterIsBusy
EnumValue.Description: he guild master or the requesting player is busy, e.g. by another request or by an ongoing guild war.

EnumValue.Name: MinimumLevel6
EnumValue.Description: The requesting player needs a minimum level of 6.

Packet.Name: GuildList
Packet.SentWhen: After a game client requested the list of players of his guild, which is usually the case when the player opens the guild dialog at the game client.
Packet.CausedReaction: The list of player is available at the client.

Structure.Name: GuildMember
Structure.Description: Contains the data of one guild member.

Packet.Name: GuildList075
Packet.SentWhen: After a game client requested the list of players of his guild, which is usually the case when the player opens the guild dialog at the game client.
Packet.CausedReaction: The list of player is available at the client.

Structure.Name: GuildMember
Structure.Description: Contains the data of one guild member.

Packet.Name: GuildKickResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After a guild master sent a request to kick a player from its guild and the server processed this request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows a message depending on the result.

Enum.Name: GuildKickSuccess
Enum.Description: The result of the guild kick request.

EnumValue.Name: FailedPasswordIncorrect
EnumValue.Description: The kick request failed because of an incorrect password.

EnumValue.Name: KickSucceeded
EnumValue.Description: The kick request was successful.

EnumValue.Name: KickFailedBecausePlayerIsNotGuildMaster
EnumValue.Description: The kick failed because player is not guild master.

EnumValue.Name: Failed
EnumValue.Description: The kick request failed.

EnumValue.Name: GuildDisband
EnumValue.Description: The guild has been disbanded.

EnumValue.Name: GuildMemberWithdrawn
EnumValue.Description: The guild member has been withdrawn.

Packet.Name: ShowGuildMasterDialog
Packet.SentWhen: After a player started talking to the guild master NPC and the player is allowed to create a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the guild master dialog.

Packet.Name: ShowGuildCreationDialog
Packet.SentWhen: After a player started talking to the guild master NPC and the player proceeds to create a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the guild creation dialog.

Packet.Name: GuildCreationResult
Packet.SentWhen: After a player requested to create a guild at the guild master NPC.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the result, a message is shown.

Enum.Name: GuildCreationErrorType
Enum.Description: Defines a guild creation error.

EnumValue.Name: None
EnumValue.Description: No error occured.

EnumValue.Name: GuildNameAlreadyTaken
EnumValue.Description: The requested guild name is already taken.

Packet.Name: GuildMemberLeftGuild
Packet.SentWhen: A player left a guild. This message is sent to the player and all surrounding players.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player is not longer shown as a guild member.

Packet.Name: GuildWarRequestResult
Packet.SentWhen: A guild master requested a guild war against another guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild master of the other guild gets this request.

Enum.Name: RequestResult
Enum.Description: Describes the result of the guild war request.

EnumValue.Name: GuildNotFound
EnumValue.Description: Failed, guild not found.

EnumValue.Name: RequestSentToGuildMaster
EnumValue.Description: Request has been sent to the guild master. Waiting for his answer.

EnumValue.Name: GuildMasterOffline
EnumValue.Description: Failed, because the guild master is offline.

EnumValue.Name: NotInGuild
EnumValue.Description: Failed, because player is not in a guild.

EnumValue.Name: Failed
EnumValue.Description: The guild war couldn't be started, e.g. because the soccer arena is already in use.

EnumValue.Name: NotTheGuildMaster
EnumValue.Description: Failed, because player is not the guild master.

EnumValue.Name: AlreadyInWar
EnumValue.Description: Failed, because the requested guild is already in a war.

Packet.Name: GuildWarRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A guild master requested a guild war against another guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild master of the other guild gets this request.

Packet.Name: GuildWarDeclared
Packet.SentWhen: A guild master requested a guild war against another guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild master of the other guild gets this request.

Packet.Name: GuildWarEnded
Packet.SentWhen: The guild war ended.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild war is shown as ended on the client side.

Enum.Name: GuildWarResult
Enum.Description: Describes the result of the guild war.

EnumValue.Name: Lost
EnumValue.Description: The war was lost.

EnumValue.Name: Won
EnumValue.Description: The war was won.

EnumValue.Name: OtherGuildMasterCancelledWar
EnumValue.Description: The war was cancelled by the other guild master.

EnumValue.Name: CancelledWar
EnumValue.Description: The war was cancelled by the own guild master.

Packet.Name: GuildWarScoreUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: The guild war score changed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild score is updated on the client side.

Packet.Name: AssignCharacterToGuild
Packet.SentWhen: The server wants to visibly assign a player to a guild, e.g. when two players met each other and one of them is a guild member.
Packet.CausedReaction: The players which belong to the guild are shown as guild players. If the game client doesn't met a player of this guild yet, it will send another request to get the guild information.

Structure.Name: GuildMemberRelation
Structure.Description: Relation between a guild and a member.

Packet.Name: AssignCharacterToGuild075
Packet.SentWhen: The server wants to visibly assign a player to a guild, e.g. when two players met each other and one of them is a guild member.
Packet.CausedReaction: The players which belong to the guild are shown as guild players. If the game client doesn't met a player of this guild yet, it will send another request to get the guild information.

Structure.Name: GuildMemberRelation
Structure.Description: Relation between a guild and a member.

Packet.Name: GuildInformation
Packet.SentWhen: A game client requested the (public) info of a guild, e.g. when it met a player of previously unknown guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The players which belong to the guild are shown as guild players.

Packet.Name: GuildInformations075
Packet.SentWhen: A player went into the scope of one or more guild members.
Packet.CausedReaction: The players which belong to the guild are shown as guild players.

Structure.Name: GuildInfo
Structure.Description: Information about one guild.

Packet.Name: SingleGuildInformation075
Packet.SentWhen: After a guild has been created. However, in OpenMU, we just send the GuildInformations075 message, because it works just the same.
Packet.CausedReaction: The players which belong to the guild are shown as guild players.

Packet.Name: VaultMoneyUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to move money between the vault and inventory.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the money values of vault and inventory.

Packet.Name: VaultClosed
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to close the vault, this confirmation is sent back to the client.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client closes the vault dialog.

Packet.Name: VaultProtectionInformation
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to open the vault.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the UI to show the current vault protection state.

Enum.Name: VaultProtectionState
Enum.Description: Defines the vault protection state.

EnumValue.Name: Unprotected
EnumValue.Description: The vault is unprotected.

EnumValue.Name: Locked
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and locked. To move items or money, the player needs to unlock it.

EnumValue.Name: UnlockFailedByWrongPin
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and locked. The user-requested unlock failed by a wrong pin.

EnumValue.Name: SetPinFailedBecauseLock
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and locked and the player-requested pin setting failed because of the lock.

EnumValue.Name: Unlocked
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected, but was unlocked by the player.

EnumValue.Name: RemovePinFailedByWrongPassword
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and the player-requested pin removal failed by using the wrong password.

Packet.Name: ItemCraftingResult
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to execute an item crafting, e.g. at the chaos machine.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the UI to show the resulting item.

Enum.Name: CraftingResult
Enum.Description: Defines the crafting result.

EnumValue.Name: Failed
EnumValue.Description: The crafting failed.

EnumValue.Name: Success
EnumValue.Description: The crafting succeeded.

EnumValue.Name: NotEnoughMoney
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because of missing money.

EnumValue.Name: TooManyItems
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because of too many items.

EnumValue.Name: CharacterLevelTooLow
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because the character level is too low.

EnumValue.Name: LackingMixItems
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because of missing items.

EnumValue.Name: IncorrectMixItems
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because of incorrect items.

EnumValue.Name: InvalidItemLevel
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because of an invalid item level.

EnumValue.Name: CharacterClassTooLow
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because the character class is too low.

EnumValue.Name: IncorrectBloodCastleItems
EnumValue.Description: The blood castle ticket crafting wasn't executed because the BloodCastle items are not correct.

EnumValue.Name: NotEnoughMoneyForBloodCastle
EnumValue.Description: The crafting wasn't executed because the player has not enough money for the blood castle ticket crafting.

Packet.Name: CraftingDialogClosed075
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to close the crafting dialog, this confirmation is sent back to the client.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client closes the crafting dialog.

Packet.Name: LegacyQuestStateList
Packet.SentWhen: After the player entered the game with his character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the quest state for the quest dialog accordingly.

Packet.Name: LegacyQuestStateDialog
Packet.SentWhen: When the player clicks on the quest npc.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the next steps in the quest dialog.

Field.Name: State
Field.Description: This is the complete byte with the state of four quests within the same byte.

Packet.Name: LegacySetQuestStateResponse
Packet.SentWhen: As response to the set state request (C1A2).
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the new quest state.

Field.Name: Result
Field.Description: This value is 0 if successful. Otherwise, 0xFF or even other magic values.

Field.Name: NewState
Field.Description: This is the complete byte with the state of four quests within the same byte.

Packet.Name: LegacyQuestReward
Packet.SentWhen: As response to the completed quest of a player in scope.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the reward accordingly.

Enum.Name: QuestRewardType
Enum.Description: Defines the reward type in the quest reward message.

EnumValue.Name: LevelUpPoints
EnumValue.Description: The character receives additional points.

EnumValue.Name: CharacterEvolutionFirstToSecond
EnumValue.Description: The character class changes from the first to the second class.

EnumValue.Name: LevelUpPointsPerLevelIncrease
EnumValue.Description: The character receives additional points per level.

EnumValue.Name: ComboSkill
EnumValue.Description: The character receives the ability to perform skill combinations.

EnumValue.Name: CharacterEvolutionSecondToThird
EnumValue.Description: The character class changes from the second to the third class.

Packet.Name: LegacyQuestMonsterKillInfo
Packet.SentWhen: As response when a player opens the quest npc with a running quest which requires monster kills.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the current state.

Structure.Name: MonsterKillInfo
Structure.Description: A pair of Monster number and the current kill count.

Packet.Name: PetMode
Packet.SentWhen: After the client sent a PetAttackCommand (as confirmation), or when the previous command finished and the pet is reset to Normal-mode.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client updates the pet mode in its user interface.

Packet.Name: PetAttack
Packet.SentWhen: After the client sent a PetAttackCommand, the pet attacks automatically. For each attack, the player and all observing players get this message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the pet attacking the target.

Enum.Name: PetSkillType
Enum.Description: Describes the type of the pet attack.

EnumValue.Name: SingleTarget
EnumValue.Description: A single target attack, used for critical and excellent hits.

EnumValue.Name: Range
EnumValue.Description: A range attack for multiple targets, usually up to 3 additional targets which all get their own PetAttack messages with 'SingleTarget' right after the first 'Range' message.

Packet.Name: PetInfoResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the client sent a PetInfoRequest for a pet (dark raven, horse).
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the information about the pet.

Packet.Name: MessengerInitialization
Packet.Caption: MUssenger initialization / friend list
Packet.SentWhen: After entering the game with a character.

Structure.Name: Friend
Structure.Description: The structure which contains the friend name and online state.

Field.Name: ServerId
Field.Description: The server id on which the player currently is online. 0xFF means offline.

Packet.Name: FriendAdded
Packet.SentWhen: After a friend has been added to the friend list.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend appears in the friend list.

Field.Name: ServerId
Field.Description: The server id on which the player currently is online. 0xFF means offline.

Packet.Name: FriendRequest
Packet.SentWhen: After a player has requested to add another player as friend. This other player gets this message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend request appears on the user interface.

Packet.Name: FriendDeleted
Packet.SentWhen: After a friend has been removed from the friend list.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend is removed from the friend list.

Packet.Name: FriendOnlineStateUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After a friend has been added to the friend list.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend appears in the friend list.

Field.Name: ServerId
Field.Description: The server id on which the player currently is online. 0xFF means offline.

Packet.Name: LetterSendResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to send a letter to another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the result, the letter send dialog closes or an error message appears.

Enum.Name: LetterSendRequestResult
Enum.Description: Describes the result of a letter send request.

EnumValue.Name: TryAgain
EnumValue.Description: The letter wasn't sent because there was an internal problem. The user should try again.

EnumValue.Name: Success
EnumValue.Description: The letter was sent.

EnumValue.Name: MailboxFull
EnumValue.Description: The mailbox of the recipient is full.

EnumValue.Name: ReceiverNotExists
EnumValue.Description: The receiver does not exist.

EnumValue.Name: CantSendToYourself
EnumValue.Description: A letter can't be sent to yourself.

EnumValue.Name: NotEnoughMoney
EnumValue.Description: The sender doesn't have enough money to send a letter.

Packet.Name: AddLetter
Packet.SentWhen: After a letter has been received or after the player entered the game with a character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter appears in the letter list.

Enum.Name: LetterState
Enum.Description: Describes the state of a letter.

EnumValue.Name: Read
EnumValue.Description: The letter was read before.

EnumValue.Name: Unread
EnumValue.Description: The letter wasn't read yet.

EnumValue.Name: New
EnumValue.Description: The letter is new (= was just sent by the sender) and wasn't read yet. It will notify the user about the received letter.

Packet.Name: OpenLetter
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to read a letter.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter is opened in a new dialog.

Packet.Name: RemoveLetter
Packet.SentWhen: After a letter has been deleted by the request of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter is removed from the letter list.

Packet.Name: ChatRoomConnectionInfo
Packet.SentWhen: The player is invited to join a chat room on the chat server.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client connects to the chat server and joins the chat room with the specified authentication data.

Packet.Name: FriendInvitationResult
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to add another player to his friend list and the server processed this request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client knows if the invitation could be sent to the other player.

Packet.Name: QuestEventResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested the list of event quests after entering the game. It seems to be sent only if the character is not a member of a Gen.
Packet.CausedReaction: Unknown.

Packet.Name: AvailableQuests
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested the list of available quests through an NPC dialog.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the available quests for the currently interacting NPC.

Packet.Name: QuestStepInfo
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client clicked on a quest in the quest list, proceeded with a quest or refused to start a quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the corresponding description about the current quest step.

Field.Name: QuestStepNumber
Field.Description: A number specifying the description: A) when selecting a quest in the quest list, it's the "StartingNumber"; B) when a quest has been started it's the quest number; C) when the starting number has been sent previously and the player refused to start the quest, it sends a "RefuseNumber".

Packet.Name: QuestProgress
Packet.SentWhen: First, after the game client requested to initialize a quest and the quest is already active. Second, after the game client requested the next quest step.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the quest progress accordingly.

Packet.Name: QuestCompletionResponse
Packet.SentWhen: The server acknowledges the completion of a quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the success and possibly requests for the next available quests.

Packet.Name: QuestCancelled
Packet.SentWhen: The server acknowledges the requested cancellation of a quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client resets the state of the quest and can request a new list of available quests again. This list would then probably contain the cancelled quest again.

Field.Name: QuestNumber
Field.Description: The current quest number. In this message, it's always 0, because the group is relevant for the client.

Packet.Name: QuestStateList
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested the list of all quests which are currently in progress or accepted.
Packet.CausedReaction: Unknown.

Packet.Name: QuestState
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested it, when the player opened the quest menu and clicked on a quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the quest progress accordingly.

Packet.Name: OpenNpcDialog
Packet.SentWhen: The server acknowledges the requested opening of an npc dialog.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client opens the dialog of the specified npc.

Enum.Name: GuildMemberRole
Enum.Description: Defines the role of a guild member.

EnumValue.Name: NormalMember
EnumValue.Description: The member is a normal member without special rights.

EnumValue.Name: BattleMaster
EnumValue.Description: The member is a battle master.

EnumValue.Name: GuildMaster
EnumValue.Description: The member is the guild master.

EnumValue.Name: Undefined
EnumValue.Description: The character is not a member, therefore the role is undefined.

Enum.Name: GuildWarType
Enum.Description: Describes the type of the guild war.

EnumValue.Name: Normal
EnumValue.Description: A normal guild war.

EnumValue.Name: Soccer
EnumValue.Description: A guild soccer match.

Enum.Name: CharacterStatus
Enum.Description: The status of a character.

EnumValue.Name: Normal
EnumValue.Description: The state of the character is normal.

EnumValue.Name: Banned
EnumValue.Description: The character is banned from the game.

EnumValue.Name: GameMaster
EnumValue.Description: The character is a game master.

Enum.Name: ConditionType
Enum.Description: Defines the type of the condition.

EnumValue.Name: None
EnumValue.Description: No condition is defined.

EnumValue.Name: MonsterKills
EnumValue.Description: The condition is to kill a specified amount of specified monsters.

EnumValue.Name: Skill
EnumValue.Description: The condition is to learn a specified skill.

EnumValue.Name: Item
EnumValue.Description: The condition is to find a specified item and to have it in the inventory.

EnumValue.Name: Level
EnumValue.Description: The condition is to reach the specified character level.

EnumValue.Name: ClientAction
EnumValue.Description: The condition is a client action. For example, this may be the completion of a tutorial.

EnumValue.Name: RequestBuff
EnumValue.Description: The condition is to request a buff from an NPC.

Enum.Name: RewardType
Enum.Description: Defines the reward which is given when the quest is completed.

EnumValue.Name: None
EnumValue.Description: No reward is defined.

EnumValue.Name: Experience
EnumValue.Description: The reward is added experience to the character.

EnumValue.Name: Money
EnumValue.Description: The reward is added money to the inventory.

EnumValue.Name: Item
EnumValue.Description: The reward is an item which is added to the inventory.

EnumValue.Name: GensContribution
EnumValue.Description: The reward is added gens contribution points.
